thread.title: Justin Bieber upset by unauthorized full-frontal nudes; his dad, not so much
thread.title_full: Justin Bieber upset by unauthorized full-frontal nudes; his dad, not so much

author: Christie D&apos;Zurilla
title: Justin Bieber upset by unauthorized full-frontal nudes; his dad, not so much
text:
Justin Bieber upset by unauthorized full-frontal nudes; his dad, not so much Justin Bieber Dean Lewins / EPA 
Justin Bieber performs before 1,200 fans on -- we're not going to say it -- Cockatoo Island in Sydney, Australia, in late September. 
Justin Bieber performs before 1,200 fans on -- we're not going to say it -- Cockatoo Island in Sydney, Australia, in late September. (Dean Lewins / EPA) Christie D'Zurilla Contact Reporter 
Justin Bieber's beast is on the loose -- and he's not happy about it. 
Full-frontal nudes of the pop singer, taken while he was on vacation in Bora Bora with rumored girlfriend Jayde Pierce, were purchased by the New York Daily News, which published them online Wednesday in a slide show online that had the naughty bits, front and back, getting the black bar treatment. 
Of course, the unedited pictures made it online as well, because that's what happens with naked pictures. 
Bieber's legal team sent the Daily News a cease-and-desist letter Thursday, alleging that distribution of the unauthorized pictures constitutes a violation of their client's publicity and privacy rights, with a little trademark infringement thrown in for good measure, according to the Hollywood Reporter . A lawsuit has been threatened if the newspaper doesn't comply, THR said. 
But TMZ speculated that it's unlikely anyone will sue, because it's heard that once the pictures were leaked, the 21-year-old got over his anger because, well, he makes a good impression.
